Mayor & City Council
====================

Overview
--------

The legislative and governing body of the city shall consist of a mayor and five council members. The mayor is elected from the city at large. The election of members of the city council is by position from the city at large, designating council positions as position one through position five. In each odd-numbered year, two council members and a mayor shall be elected, and in each even-numbered year, three council members shall be elected.

Meetings
--------

The Angleton City Council meets regularly on the second and fourth Tuesdays of each month at City Hall. Â Meetings are held at 6:00 p.m. in the Council Chamber. Â Meeting agendas are officially posted in the lobby window at City Hall at least 72 hours prior to a public meeting and posted on the City's web.

**City Council is accepting request from citizens to hold a Town Hall meeting within their neighborhood to address ideas and/or concerns for their specific area. Council plans to hold 2 or more neighborhood town hall meetings yearly. Prior to submitting the request, a location to hold the Town Hall meeting must have already been selected with requested permission.**Â 

[Town Hall Meeting Request Form](https://portal.laserfiche.com/q3869/forms/Council-Town-Hall)Â
